name: Kick-off Networking Mixer

venue.name: German House / Center for Latino Arts & Culture

description:
Let's get together and talk about our interests. We will have simple ice-breaker activities to get us started.

We will share our vision for the meetup, results of the ongoing poll, and learn about each other. Please vote in the poll, if you haven't already.

6:30pm - Doors open
7:00pm - Quick Introduction of the Meetup group
7:20pm - Q&A/open discussion
8:00pm onwards - Networking

Meetup cover image source: Photo by Brodie Vissers (https://burst.shopify.com/@thenomadbrodie)

name: Cloud Next ’18 Extended - New Brunswick
description:
This meetup is all about Google Cloud, where you can find out the latest announcements about the platform, go through an hands-on coding session to learn Google Cloud skills, and share your ideas.

You can also rsvp here: https://next18ext-nb.splashthat.com/

Agenda:
10:00am to 12:00pm - CodeLab
12:00pm to 1:00pm - Lunch break (Lunch Will be Provided)
1:00pm to 1:15pm - Announcements at Cloud Next ‘18
1:15pm to 1:55pm - Watch a recorded session
1:55pm to 2:10pm - break / networking
2:10pm to 2:40pm - Local presentations
2:40pm to 3:00pm - Q&A, Future Meetup Announcements

Please bring your laptop and charger for CodeLab. Attendees will get free access to https://google.qwiklabs.com, so everyone can participate in hands-on learning. Every attendee who receives the Qwiklabs promo URL will receive free access to Qwiklabs for 1 month. If you earn a badge within the first month, you will get a second month of free access.

Interested in getting a Cloud Specialization Certificate from Coursera?Join us to learn how you can get a 30-day free subscription to complete one of FIVE available Cloud Specializations from Coursera.

name: Flutter Study Jam - Part 1 of 3
description:
Our very first Study Jam Series. This is Part 1 of 3 meetups, with two weeks' break in between.

RSVP: https://flutterstudyjam-nb.splashthat.com

Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course - Building Native Mobile Apps with Flutter - prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals.

Link to Udacity course: https://www.udacity.com/course/build-native-mobile-apps-with-flutter--ud905

Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine. Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

Agenda:
10:00am: Flutter Udacity Course Introduction
10:15am: Udacity Course Lesson 1
11:45am: Brunch (*** Food will be provided ***)
12:00pm: Udacity Course Lesson 1 continue
1:00pm: Event ends

name: Flutter Study Jam - Part 2 of 3
description:
This is Part 2 of our Flutter Study Jam series.

RSVP: https://flutterstudyjam-pt2-nb.splashthat.com

We will continue going through the Udacity course (https://www.udacity.com/course/build-native-mobile-apps-with-flutter--ud905) on Getting started with Flutter
If you couldn't join us for Part 1, you can still join us at this event and get started.

Make sure you have installed following and are ready to code:
1. Flutter SDK - https://flutter.io/get-started/install/
2. Android Studio - https://developer.android.com/studio/
Upon installing, Android Studio will automatically start downloading Android SDK.
3. Flutter plugin - https://flutter.io/using-ide/#installation-and-setup
4. Create and Run your first flutter project
- https://flutter.io/using-ide/#creating-a-new-project
- https://flutter.io/using-ide/#running-and-debugging

Just to reiterate - Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

Bring a laptop and the charger.

Agenda:
10:00am: Lesson 1 Recap
10:15am: Udacity Course Lesson 2
11:45am: Brunch (*** Food will be provided ***)
12:00pm: Udacity Course Lesson 2 continue
1:00pm: Event ends

name: Flutter Study Jam - Showcase
description:
This is Last part of our Flutter Study Jam series.

RSVP: https://flutterstudyjam-showcase-nb.splashthat.com

Hopefully, you are on track to finish the Udacity course. Even if you aren't, we would love to hear about your experience and see how far you have come in the course.

Even if you couldn't join us for Part 1 and/or 2, you can still join us at this event and at least get started. This way, you will also get access to the slack channel, where learning happens post-meetup.

Make sure you have installed following and are ready to code:
1. Flutter SDK - https://flutter.io/get-started/install/
2. Android Studio - https://developer.android.com/studio/
Upon installing, Android Studio will automatically start downloading Android SDK.
3. Flutter plugin - https://flutter.io/using-ide/#installation-and-setup
4. Create and Run your first flutter project
- https://flutter.io/using-ide/#creating-a-new-project
- https://flutter.io/using-ide/#running-and-debugging

Just to reiterate - Everyone, who completes the course will get a Google-offered Study Jam completion certificate and a profile badge.

Bring a laptop and the charger, and headphones (just in case)

Agenda:
10:00am: Recap of Flutter
10:30am: Recap of Udacity Course
11:30am: Showcase / Discussions / Q&A

name: Android Dev Summit - Virtual
description:
TOMORROW !! Hopefully, you will be able to catch few of the sessions. Livestream will be available here: https://developer.android.com/dev-summit/
And, if you can make it to NYC, you should definitely register for viewing party at AMC Loews 34th Street. Register here: https://events.withgoogle.com/android-dev-summit-viewing-parties/

name: DevFest Holidays Extravaganza
description:
Let's get together for another, big event of the year - DevFest. We will have talks, we will have codelabs, workshop, hackathons and lots of cool gadgets to win. We will also celebrate holidays, so we can have fun while we learn.This is going to be epic! Join the slack channel #devfest18 for more details - System Requirements for Codelabs, and ARCore Workshop, Hackathon Ideas and Judging Criteria, and prizes to win.

**** Special Announcement - Best, first-time female speaker Awardee gets a Google Home Hub ****

RSVP Here: https://devfestholidayparty.splashthat.com/

Join our slack channel at https://join.slack.com/t/gdg-nb/shared_invite/enQtNDgxNDU1NDM2NjU3LTc3ZDNmNDg0ZDNkNjdiOWI2YTlkZGZkZGJkYzM2MjhkZWY3Njc3MmUyNDI3ODRjMWQ3M2FkNzNkNTg0ODY3MmU

Agenda:
11:00AM - Welcome and Networking. Wear your ethnic best for a chance to win a Google Home Mini.
11:20AM - Pulling the Strings of Web DX by Westbrook Johnson
11:40AM - Material Design 2.0 by Ernest Grzybowski
12:00PM - Speed up Android Development with Jetpack by Vikram Mada
12:20PM - Observables with RxJS by Purnima Nagpal
12:40PM - Feast n Play (There will be prizes - 4 Google Chromecasts to be won)
1:00PM - Track 1:
Session: Google Cloud - All you can code buffet - Speaker TBA
CodeLabs: Qwiklabs (Chance to win 3 Google Home mini(s) for completing full 'quests' within a week)
1:00PM - Track 2: ARCore Workshop (Chance to win a Daydream VR headset. Complete this workshop, i.e. having the completed app deployed on an android phone)
1:00PM - Track 3: Mini-Hackathon -
Topics -
AI for Social Good - https://ai.google/social-good,
Visualize 2030 - https://cloud.google.com/visualize-2030/.
Team with the best new idea, or best adaptation of existing idea and execution will win "Google Home". Must join Slack Channel for more details, including resources, starter kits, judging criteria, presentation templates. Teams will start forming, a week in advance, on Slack Channel.
4:00PM - Selection of winners and prize giveaways. Concluding remarks, 4:15PM - [Optional] Head over to nearby bar for after-party! Also on-the-house.

===============================
Code of Conduct:
All members of the Google Developer Group (New Brunswick) are expected to adhere to our Code of Conduct.
• Be nice.
• Be respectful and constructive.
• Be collaborative.

Harassment of any kind (physical, verbal, digital) will not be tolerated and can potentially lead to expulsion from events, or even from the community.
A more detailed version of the Code of Conduct is posted here (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nwI_W8-mU9S7OmK3sGaInuqy1GkjrrfBLB9GImKk4uU/edit?usp=sharing).
===============================
P.S. - Calling all who would like to present at the meetup. And, the volunteers who would like to help organize the event. Please send out a message to me.

name: DevFestOnAir - Virtual
description:
You may be busy at work. Yet, you yearn to learn. Especially, if it helps further your career goals. GDG has you covered. Please register for this virtual event - #devfestonair18 : https://devfest.withgoogle.com/events/devfestonair18
3 tracks - Cloud, Mobile, Web/Voice/more

name: Google Cloud - Global Digital Conference (Virtual)
description:
Better Code, Faster. Let's solve it.

How Developer Productivity Powers Business Impact
Build dynamic apps at the speed that customers need. Join experts and innovators to learn how to build quality code faster with CI/CD and serverless.

Register Here: https://cloudonair.withgoogle.com/events/app-dev

Why should you attend?

Insights from Google engineers
Learn about tools and practices that power developer productivity at Google, then join the experts in live Q&A sessions.

Deep dives on serverless and CI/CD
Choose the course that’s best for you, with dedicated sessions on serverless tools and building CI/CD pipelines.

Join from anywhere
It's an online conference, so you can learn from your home, office or home-office!

name: hash code - Team up and Prepare for Online Qualification Round
description:
We will meet and form teams for Hash Code 2019 - Online Qualification Round!

You can find out more about the competition, and register yourself as a participant here: http://g.co/hashcode

Registration form also has an option to let Google Recruiters know if you are interested in working for Google. So, this competition could be your gateway into Google.

Hash Code is divided into 2 stages:

Thursday, February 28th from 17:30 to 21:30 UTC: Online Qualification Round

Saturday, April 27th: Final Round for top teams at Google Ireland

Let's get ready for Hash Code 2019!

Chance to get a glimpse into software engineering at Google during Hash Code, a team programming competition that tasks developers with solving a Google engineering problem.

In past years, teams have tackled challenges such as routing self-driving cars through a simulated city and optimizing the layout of a Google data center.

******
Code of Conduct for the meetup:

All members of the Google Developer Group (New Brunswick) are expected to adhere to our Code of Conduct.

• Be nice.

• Be respectful and constructive.

• Be collaborative.

Harassment of any kind (physical, verbal, digital) will not be tolerated and can potentially lead to expulsion from events, or even from the community.

A more detailed version of the Code of Conduct is posted here (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1nwI_W8-mU9S7OmK3sGaInuqy1GkjrrfBLB9GImKk4uU/edit?usp=sharing).
******

name: Google Cloud OnBoard - NYC
description:
This round of Google Cloud OnBoard is a Machine Learning edition and will take place in New York City on February 21, 2019 at the Hilton Midtown.

This free, full-day event will provide an in-depth and technical introduction to Google Cloud Platform’s data processing and machine learning capabilities. It will bring you up to speed on the Google Cloud Platform and then move on to data analysis in the cloud, scaling data analysis, machine learning, and data processing architecture.

This OnBoard ML is going to fill up fast, so register here to reserve your seat! https://cloudplatformonline.com/OnBoard-Northam-ML.html

At day's end, you will get a signed Certificate of Participation and a Cloud OnBoard t-shirt. You will also get free access to Qwiklabs so that you can practice the skills you learned during OnBoard.

name: Google Cloud - Study Jam
description:
Demand for DEVs with Cloud Skills is growing rapidly. https://www.forbes.com/sites/louiscolumbus/2018/11/27/where-cloud-computing-jobs-will-be-in-2019

Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console, Kubernetes, Security, IoT on Cloud, and Machine Learning.
The Labs in the agenda are meant for beginners. You may choose your own labs, according to your level of expertise with GCP.

Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

Sign up for a Qwiklabs account, if you don't already have one set up: https://google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up
(creating an account is free).

Learn more about the Qwiklabs platform: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cyp7soKLOYI

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

Agenda:
11:00 am - Welcome!
11:05 am - Get free access to Qwiklabs
11:10 am - Lab 1: Getting Started with Cloud Shell & gcloud
11:45 am - Lab 2: Creating a Virtual Machine
12:10 pm - Lab 3: Hello Node Kubernetes
12:30 pm - Break (Lunch will be provided)
1:00 pm - Play multi-player online game - Prizes to be won!!
2:00 pm - Wrap Up!

name: Become a #CloudHero - Online Competition about Google Cloud
description:
### This online event is separate from our Next '19 Extended meetup. And, you can attend it from the comfort of your home or office or nearby starbucks or Panera, in short wherever you have a good internet connection ###

### https://cloudonair.withgoogle.com/events/app-dev/demo - You can pre-register on this page and attend any one of the four 90-minutes sessions ###

#### If you need some credits on Qwiklabs.com to practice for this global, online competition, please send your email address to me, and I can share some of my credits with you ###

What is a Cloud Hero?
Community members from all around the globe will have an opportunity to participate in the Hands-on Labs experience @ Next ‘19. We will participate in one of the Cloud Hero Sessions and play the Cloud Hero game in the same platform, against players at the event.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GFxTCcDW1fw

What does a participant do?
There will be 12 GCP challenges with a time limit of 60 minutes each. During the 90 minutes of the Cloud Hero sessions, players need to play through it as fast as they can to earn points and win the session.

The Cloud Hero lab challenges you to build an end-to-end application deployment experience using multiple GCP services, from GCS to GKE and Cloud Build. By the end of this lab you will have a complete CI/CD pipeline for automatically building and deploying an application on the Google Cloud.

*** UPDATES ***
All Cloud Hero players will have a special badge on Qwiklabs and best players will be recognized globally.

All participants will receive 50 Qwiklabs credits. The first three players to complete the challenge will receive an additional 100 Qwiklabs credits.

All participants will receive their first month free on Google Cloud Platform Training on Coursera.

Please check out the photo, in this meetup event, to get an idea about the structure of the game.

Please join our #cloudHero-next19 slack channel - https://join.slack.com/t/gdg-nb/shared_invite/enQtNTg2NDAxNTg0NTQ5LTNhMmNlZjY0ODc5MzE1ZDIxMzcwMGM5ZDBjMGMxM2NiMTJkZDA5NWUzMWUyOTBlYTkzYWE4Y2ZhMGI3ODE4YTQ

name: Google Cloud Next ’19 Extended - New Brunswick
description:
Cloud Next '19 takes place in San Francisco between April 9th and 11th.
It's "THE" conference for all-things-Google Cloud. Here's a teaser of what it is about - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WPfyjzgBEJU

You can watch it via livestream here: https://cloud.withgoogle.com/next/sf/next-onair

And, join us at this meetup, where we will share highlights from that big event in a short condensed format.

Agenda:
11:00AM - 11:30AM : Networking / Introduce Yourself
11:30AM - 12:00PM : Cloud Next '19 Recap - by Daniel Dantas
12:00PM - 12:30PM : Watch a recorded session from Cloud Next '19
12:30PM - 1:00PM : LUNCH (will be provided)
1:00PM - 2:00PM : Running WordPress on App Engine Flexible Environment - using Qwiklabs (Or, you can pick your own lab)

Attendees will get free access to https://google.qwiklabs.com, so everyone can participate in hands-on learning. Every attendee who receives the Qwiklabs promo URL will receive free access to Qwiklabs for 1 month. If you earn a badge within the first month, you will get a second month of free access.
